Get the geometry of a route shape.

Source: R/gtfs_helpers.R
get_shape_geometry.Rd

This function returns an SF multilinestring of the route alignments from GTFS shapes. Similar to tidytransit's get_geometry(), but allows filtering by shape_id and projection to a new coordinate system. See Details for requirements on the input GTFS.

Usage

get_shape_geometry(gtfs, shape = NULL, project_crs = 4326)

Arguments

gtfs

A tidygtfs object.

shape

Optional. The GTFS shape_id to use. Can be a single value, or a vector. Default is NULL, where all shape_ids in gtfs will be used.

project_crs

Optional. A numeric EPSG identifer indicating the coordinate system to use for spatial calculations. Consider setting to a Euclidian projection, such as the appropriate UTM zone. Default is 4326 (WGS 84 ellipsoid).

Value

An SF multilinestring, with one multilinestring object per shape_id.

Details

A shapes file must be present in your GTFS object. This file must contain at least the following fields:

  • shape_id

  • shape_pt_lat

  • shape_pt_lon

  • shape_pt_sequence
